channel.title: Server Processing
channel.description: So I was wondering how i would about server processes. Pi has many different process, and I was wondering would it be good to make only one process run the full game? Or should i clean p the processes to make it run a little quicker or what? Please give me your thoughts and answers on this topic :)

item.title: Server Processing
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

ummm this doesn’t make much sense. like people said before taking methods and merging them into one big clusterfuck is a retarded idea and isn’t going to improve anything

if you want to reduce overhead on the game thread start by cleaning out the process() methods for both players and npcs, just a heads up the only thing that those methods should be used for is packet processing and walking

also remove those stupid object ticks I see in PI, its a terrible idea and it isn’t even used by people that use pi nor is it needed

another thing I see in project insanity is like 5+ task/event systems that run on the game thread (causing unnecessary overhead) or running on their own dedicated threads (thread safety concern and eating up resources) when they aren’t even being used… stick to one cycle based task system

you can reduce overhead and squash other problems even further by doing all disk i/o on a separate thread

or you know… you can save all of that work and use a server that doesn’t suck lol

Read full topic

Thank you very much everyone

item.title: Server Processing
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

You’re not going to get any speedup either way… function call overhead is minimal. Just do whatever makes your code easier to manage.

Read full topic
